text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with super quick and easy black
bean soup is this as good as that one
that takes a long time and uses the dry
beans and all the slicing and chopping
and dicing and mincing no but it's not
supposed to be this is supposed to be a
fast easy yet still delicious bean soup
recipe alright so step one we're going
to throw a handful of chopped bacon in a
dry cold soup pot i'm going to turn that
on medium heat and I'm going to cook
that until it's cooked but not crisp
if you keep going it will get really
crispy and a lot more fat will come out
but I don't necessarily want it that way
for this particular recipe at that point
I'm going to add a chopped onion and I'm
going to cook that onion sweat that
onion in that bacon fat for about five
minutes until it starts to turn
translucent and just starts turning
golden when the onions look like that
I'm going to throw in some minced garlic
let that cook another two or three
minutes and then we're going to add a
couple cups of chicken broth you can of
course use vegetable stock which you
know pear is great with bacon alright at
that point we can turn our heat up to
medium-high because we're going to bring
this up to a simmer while we're waiting
I'm going to add some dry oregano some
cayenne and a big pinch of salt we're
definitely going to need more salt later
but I'll start with a little pinch here
oh and that reminds me I've gotten a lot
of emails and comments about why is
there a hole in your wooden spoon that
is really an interesting interesting
question alright so we're going to give
that a stir and we're going to throw in
two cans of black beans those have been
drained and rinsed alright I don't want
any of that disgusting bean surp in this
okay we're also going to add one can
that the beans came in one cans worth of
water alright
so leave the heat on medium high that's
going to come back to a simmer and
you'll notice a little bit of foam will
come to the top as it simmers all that
is is some of the protein from the beans
and a little bit of the fat from the
bacon making a foam on top you could
skim it if you want really not necessary
as soon as that comes up to a simmer I
want you to turn the heat down to
medium-low and gently simmer this for
about 20 minutes
and you're pretty much going to be done
so what I want you to do during this
simmering time is take a potato masher
and mash approximately half the beans
against the bottom of the pot if you
want to mess up a blender you could
definitely puree one of the cans of
beans before you add it but why wash a
blender when you don't have to and also
not just not cleaning the blender but
standing here for three minutes crushing
those beans is the kind of mini
meditation that cooking at home is all
about that is three minutes where you're
thinking of nothing except smashing
beans it is amazing how therapeutic that
is for your brain all right after about
three minutes I had half the beans
approximately mashed and that's going to
give the soup a nice thickness a
beautiful texture and that will
definitely thicken up more as it cooks
so it doesn't look super thick now but
it will thicken as it simmers all right
so we're going to let that simmer we're
going to stir occasionally I'm also
going to finish off the seasoning with
some black pepper some cumin and another
pinch of salt and basically that's
pretty much done when you're happy with
the texture if I wanted it to be a
little thicker I could smash some more
beans I could let it reduce if I want a
thinner I can add more liquid of course
and so forth so you know what I'm always
saying you are the boss of your black
bean soup
act like it alright see that that's just
about what I'm going for
so my soup is looking just about almost
done I'm going to keep that on low while
I prep a nice green onion red pepper
relish to garnish the top all this is is
some chopped up green onion a spoon of
crushed chilies and some lime juice all
right so I'm going to stir that up now
I'm using a crushed chili paste here you
could totally use minced up red jalapeno
or Fresno chilies you could use sambal
all right so that's going to be a really
nice colorful flavorful texturally
important garnish for the top all right
back to the soup for final service of
course you're going to taste and adjust
seasoning my needed a little more salt
all right don't be surprised if yours
does too and then at this point I said
to myself hey chef John your soup is
ready and I was pretty happy to hear
that because I was starving all right to
serve we're going to ladle this and some
warm bowls I'm going to put a dollop or
a dollop of sour cream on
hop now I'm using what's called crema
which is a Mexican sour cream very
delicious you could also use creme
fraiche
ideally homemade but sour cream will
work I'm going to put a nice spoon of
our pepper green onion lime relish maybe
a few more green onions on top and there
you go and by the way that garnish while
colorful and beautiful also serves a
very important purpose things like black
bean soup could potentially be very
tedious so you need something to kind of
break things up so the sharpness from
that mince green onion and the heat from
the pepper and the acidity from the lime
and also the tankiness from the sour
cream really balances out this soup
perfectly and of course you can leave
out the bacon all together but if you
bring this for a potluck and there are
vegetarians and people that don't eat
pork there think about it larger portion
sizes for everybody who does so you do
have that going for you anyway there you
go quick simple easy beautiful and
delicious black bean soup I don't know
much but one thing I do know people like
soup people like soup a lot so I hope
you give this a try soon all the
ingredients are on food wishes comm of
course and as always enjoy
